page.title: 01Outline of Chilton area.
page.content: The D block comprises an area of undulating land the bulk of which supports mixed farming. There are four main areas of settle ment. The largest of these by far is {Chilton}with some 5500 inhabitants. {Rushyford,}one kilometre south, includes a residential hotel and a small private housing estate.{Bradbury is a hamlet 3 kilometres SE of Chilton. The southern tip of{Ferryhill just impinges the block on its northern boundary. Once an area heavily dependant on coal mining this activity has now ceased and employment in the area is found mainly in nearby light industrial estates. The area is crossed, in a north south direction,by the A1(M), the main east coast railway line,and the former A1, which passed through Chilton.
